alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 2:02PM CDT until July 20 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING THAT WAS EARLIER IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Blount and Sevier. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams may continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall this morning and early afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated more light to moderate rain and will continue through the afternoon. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen this morning to mid afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, Elkmont, Wears Valley, Roundtop Mountain State Park, Harrisburg, Great Smoky Mountains National Park and Seymour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
